intro: Mesembryanthemum steenbergense, commonly known as the Steenberg's ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It typically blooms in spring and summer, producing white or pale pink flowers. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
